LIRR Morning Rush Service Advisory for Tuesday, March 31

Ronkonkoma Branch customers should anticipate 15-25 minute delays during Tuesday morning's rush hour, due to the damage to the LIRR's signal system caused by yesterday's freight car derailment in Wyandanch. LIRR trains are continuing to operate at a reduced speed between Farmingdale and Wyandanch. Re-railing efforts are continuing. Once the derailment site is cleared, the LIRR's signal system can be repaired and tested.

LIRR Service Advisory for Monday Morning's Rush Hour, March 23

The LIRR is advising customers to anticipate canceled and diverted trains as well as delays during the morning rush hour on Monday, March 23, due to the derailment of a non-passenger train in the LIRR's Westside Yard. LIRR crews will be working throughout the night and overnight to re-rail the derailed cars. For the latest service updates please monitor www.mta.info, download the LIRR's TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter & Facebook.

A Line – Weeknight and Weekday Planned Service Changes

NIGHTS 11:45 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Mar 23 – 27 207 St-bound A trains run express from Canal St to 59 St-Columbus Circle. All times until Summer 2015 Far Rockaway/Lefferts Blvd-bound A trains skip Rockaway Blvd. • To this station, take the Far Rockaway-bound A to Aqueduct-North Conduit Av or the Lefferts Blvd-bound A to 104 St and transfer to a Brooklyn-bound A. • From this station, take a Brooklyn-bound A to 88 St and transfer to a Far Rockaway or Lefferts Blvd-bound A.

10:15 AM to 3 PM, Mon and Tue, Mar 23 – 24 Main St-bound 7 service runs express from 74 St-Broadway to Willets Point. 10:15 AM to 3 PM, Wed to Fri, Mar 25 – 27 Main St-bound 7 service runs express from Queensboro Plaza to 74 St-Broadway.
6 Line – Weekday and Weeknight Planned Service Changes

All times until Spring 2015 6 service skips Zerega Av and Buhre Av in both directions. • To/from Zerega Av, use the Bx4 and/or shuttle buses to connect between Zerega Av and Castle Hill Av; free transfer is available with MetroCard. • To/from Buhre Av, use the Bx8, Bx24, and/or shuttle buses to connect between Buhre Av and Middletown Rd or Pelham Bay Park. Free transfer is available with MetroCard. Note: Shuttle buses operate during rush hours and late nights only between Castle Hill Av and Pelham Bay Park, stopping at Zerega Av, Westchester Sq, Middletown Rd, and Buhre Av.

You don't need the luck of the Irish to travel to the St. Patrick's Day Parade on Tuesday, March 17th — there will be plenty of trains to choose from since we’ll be operating our regular Hudson, Harlem and New Haven Line weekday schedules. On the Hudson Line, we will have an extra train departing Poughkeepsie at 8:23 AM, stopping at New Hamburg, Beacon and Grand Central Terminal. Also on the Hudson Line, tickets will be collected prior to boarding at Poughkeepsie, New Hamburg and Beacon Stations due to high parade ridership. Customers at these stations MUST already have, or buy their tickets at ticket machines or ticket offices BEFORE boarding trains. Customers will not be allowed on platforms without a ticket. See more details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/stpats.htm We encourage regular customers (non-parade goers) to plan for very crowded trains and, if possible, shift travel plans accordingly. You don't need the luck of the Irish to travel to the St. Patrick's Day Parade on Tuesday, March 17th — there will be plenty of trains to choose from since we’ll be operating our regular Hudson, Harlem and New Haven Line weekday schedules. On the Hudson Line, we will have an extra train departing Poughkeepsie at 8:23 AM, stopping at New Hamburg, Beacon and Grand Central Terminal. Also on the Hudson Line, tickets will be collected prior to boarding at Poughkeepsie, New Hamburg and Beacon Stations due to high parade ridership. Customers at these stations MUST already have, or buy their tickets at ticket machines or ticket offices BEFORE boarding trains. Customers will not be allowed on platforms without a ticket. See more details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/stpats.htm We encourage regular customers (non-parade goers) to plan for very crowded trains and, if possible, shift travel plans accordingly. See train schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk . Note: On Tuesday, March 17th

New York City Football Club "Train to the Game" Service starts Mar. 15.

Cheer on the latest addition to the NY sports family at Yankee Stadium – the New York City Football Club (NYCFC). Their home opener is this Sunday, March 15! To get you to the stadium and ready for kickoff, take Metro-North’s frequent and convenient "Train to the Game" service to every NYCFC home game. See train times at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/mls/nycfc_mls.htm .

Buses Replace Ronkonkoma Br. Trains, Sun. March 8

Buses replace Ronkonkoma Branch trains today thru 1:30 AM Mon. March 9 while trackwork is performed. See http://bit.ly/1E0RFlt for details. Buses Replace Ronkonkoma Br. Trains, Sun. March 8

From 12:45AM Sun. March 8, until 1:30AM Mon. March 9, buses will replace trains between Farmingdale & Ronkonkoma while trackwork is performed. See http://bit.ly/1E0RFlt for details. W/B customers at stations Ronkonkoma thru Pinelawn will board buses up to 39 mins. earlier than normal train times to Hicksville, then transfer to trains. E/B customers will transfer to buses at Hicksville for stations Pinelawn thru Ronkonkoma. At Bethpage & Farmingdale, customers will have regular train service.
